column1: '''Tarlang's Neck''' was the pass between the main range of the [[White Mountains]] and a long, mountainous spur between the sources of the [[Morthond
column2: Blackroot]] and [[Ciril]] rivers. The pass had a road in it that connected the [[Blackroot Vale]] to the west and the land of [[Lamedon]] to the east.<ref>{{RK

indigenous people]] of [[Gondor]] told of [[giants]] and one of them called [[Tarlang]] who tripped and broke his neck. The other giants did not clean up his body, which became incorporated in the land instead. The giant's neck became Tarlang's Neck, his head [[Dol Tarlang]], and the stones he was carrying [[Cûl Veleg]] and [[Cûl Bîn]].<ref>[[J.R.R. Tolkien]], ''[[Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings
column3: Nomenclature of The Lord of the Rings]]'', omitted entry quoted in [[Wayne G. Hammond]], [[Christina Scull]], ''[[The Lord of the Rings: A Reader's Companion]]'', pp. 536-7</ref>

column1: Tarlang's Neck formed part of the route by which [[Aragorn]] and the [[Grey Company]] led the [[Army of the Dead]] on their journey to the relief of [[Minas Tirith]] in the [[War of the Ring]].<ref>{{RK
''Tarlang'' was the original name of this pass, but it was later taken as a personal name.<ref name="Nomen">{{HM
:Tarlang's Neck was a small area between [[Blackroot Vale]] and [[Lamedon]] in Western [[Gondor]].
